intro: Phlomoides dszumrutensis, commonly known as the Dszumrut narrowleaf plant, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
